intro: Eremopoa, commonly known as the desert grass or sand grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. Eremopoa species are typically small, tufted grasses that thrive in harsh, dry environments. They have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, spike-like inflorescences. These plants are well adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making them important components of desert ecosystems.
